channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: xJailbreak: Representation Space Guided Reinforcement Learning for Interpretable LLM Jailbreaking
item.description: Safety alignment mechanism are essential for preventing large language models (LLMs) from generating harmful information or unethical content.

item.title: JRE-L: Journalist, Reader, and Editor LLMs in the Loop for Science Journalism for the General Audience
item.description: Science journalism reports current scientific discoveries to non-specialists, aiming to enable public comprehension of the state of the art.

item.title: Optimizing Code Runtime Performance through Context-Aware Retrieval-Augmented Generation
item.description: Optimizing software performance through automated code refinement offers a promising avenue for enhancing execution speed and efficiency.

item.title: VeriFact: Verifying Facts in LLM-Generated Clinical Text with Electronic Health Records
item.description: Methods to ensure factual accuracy of text generated by large language models (LLM) in clinical medicine are lacking.

item.title: RDMM: Fine-Tuned LLM Models for On-Device Robotic Decision Making with Enhanced Contextual Awareness in Specific Domains
item.description: This research introduces a framework that utilizes RDMM (Robotics Decision-Making Models), which possess the capacity for decision-making within domain-specific contexts, as well as an awareness of their personal knowledge and capabilities.

item.title: Solving Roughly Forced Nonlinear PDEs via Misspecified Kernel Methods and Neural Networks
item.description: We consider the use of Gaussian Processes (GPs) or Neural Networks (NNs) to numerically approximate the solutions to nonlinear partial differential equations (PDEs) with rough forcing or source terms, which commonly arise as pathwise solutions to stochastic PDEs.

item.title: FactCG: Enhancing Fact Checkers with Graph-Based Multi-Hop Data
item.description: Prior research on training grounded factuality classification models to detect hallucinations in large language models (LLMs) has relied on public natural language inference (NLI) data and synthetic data.

item.title: Mamba-Shedder: Post-Transformer Compression for Efficient Selective Structured State Space Models
item.description: Large pre-trained models have achieved outstanding results in sequence modeling.

item.title: A General Bayesian Framework for Informative Input Design in System Identification
item.description: We tackle the problem of informative input design for system identification, where we select inputs, observe the corresponding outputs from the true system, and optimize the parameters of our model to best fit the data.

item.title: Scanning Trojaned Models Using Out-of-Distribution Samples
item.description: TRODO leverages the concept of "blind spots"--regions where trojaned classifiers erroneously identify out-of-distribution (OOD) samples as in-distribution (ID).

item.title: Large Language Model Critics for Execution-Free Evaluation of Code Changes
item.description: Importantly, we assume access to the gold test patch for the problem (i. e., reference-aware) to assess both semantics and executability of generated patches.

item.title: CHiP: Cross-modal Hierarchical Direct Preference Optimization for Multimodal LLMs
item.description: To address these challenges, in this work, we propose a Cross-modal Hierarchical Direct Preference Optimization (CHiP) to address these limitations.

item.title: On Rollouts in Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Model-based reinforcement learning (MBRL) seeks to enhance data efficiency by learning a model of the environment and generating synthetic rollouts from it.

item.title: SliceOcc: Indoor 3D Semantic Occupancy Prediction with Vertical Slice Representation
item.description: To utilize these slice features, we propose SliceOcc, an RGB camera-based model specifically tailored for indoor 3D semantic occupancy prediction.

item.title: Exponential Family Attention
item.description: The self-attention mechanism is the backbone of the transformer neural network underlying most large language models.

item.title: RODEO: Robust Outlier Detection via Exposing Adaptive Out-of-Distribution Samples
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce RODEO, a data-centric approach that generates effective outliers for robust outlier detection.

item.title: Dream to Drive with Predictive Individual World Model
item.description: It is still a challenging topic to make reactive driving behaviors in complex urban environments as road users' intentions are unknown.

item.title: Hybrid Phenology Modeling for Predicting Temperature Effects on Tree Dormancy
item.description: Biophysical models offer valuable insights into climate-phenology relationships in both natural and agricultural settings.

item.title: Polyp-Gen: Realistic and Diverse Polyp Image Generation for Endoscopic Dataset Expansion
item.description: Despite recent advancements in generating synthetic images for dataset expansion, existing endoscopic image generation algorithms failed to accurately generate the details of polyp boundary regions and typically required medical priors to specify plausible locations and shapes of polyps, which limited the realism and diversity of the generated images.

item.title: Auto-Differentiating Any LLM Workflow: A Farewell to Manual Prompting
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have reshaped natural language processing, powering applications from multi-hop retrieval and question answering to autonomous agent workflows.

item.title: HateBench: Benchmarking Hate Speech Detectors on LLM-Generated Content and Hate Campaigns
item.description: In this paper, we propose HateBench, a framework for benchmarking hate speech detectors on LLM-generated hate speech.

item.title: Outlier Synthesis via Hamiltonian Monte Carlo for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: The Hamiltonian Monte Carlo with sampling acceptance rate almost close to 1 also makes our framework enjoy great efficiency.

item.title: CascadeV: An Implementation of Wurstchen Architecture for Video Generation
item.description: Recently, with the tremendous success of diffusion models in the field of text-to-image (T2I) generation, increasing attention has been directed toward their potential in text-to-video (T2V) applications.

item.title: Mixture-of-Mamba: Enhancing Multi-Modal State-Space Models with Modality-Aware Sparsity
item.description: In the Chameleon setting, Mixture-of-Mamba reaches similar image loss with just 42. 50% of the FLOPs at the 1. 4B scale, and similar text loss with just 65. 40% of the FLOPs.

item.title: SIM: Surface-based fMRI Analysis for Inter-Subject Multimodal Decoding from Movie-Watching Experiments
item.description: A key obstacle to model generalisation is the degree of variability of inter-subject cortical organisation, which makes it difficult to align or compare cortical signals across participants.

item.title: Harnessing Diverse Perspectives: A Multi-Agent Framework for Enhanced Error Detection in Knowledge Graphs
item.description: For specific industrial scenarios, our framework can facilitate the training of specialized agents using domain-specific knowledge graphs for error detection, which highlights the potential industrial application value of our framework.

item.title: Formal Verification of Markov Processes with Learned Parameters
item.description: We introduce the problem of formally verifying properties of Markov processes where the parameters are the output of machine learning models.

item.title: LLM-powered Multi-agent Framework for Goal-oriented Learning in Intelligent Tutoring System
item.description: After identifying the skill gap, it schedules an efficient learning path using an evolving optimization approach, driven by a comprehensive and dynamic profile of learners' multifaceted status.

item.title: Efficiency Bottlenecks of Convolutional Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks: A Comprehensive Scrutiny with ImageNet, AlexNet, LeNet and Tabular Classification
item.description: Algorithmic level developments like Convolutional Neural Networks, transformers, attention mechanism, Retrieval Augmented Generation and so on have changed Artificial Intelligence.

item.title: Multi-View Attention Syntactic Enhanced Graph Convolutional Network for Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis (ABSA) is the task aimed at predicting the sentiment polarity of aspect words within sentences.

item.title: Upside Down Reinforcement Learning with Policy Generators
item.description: Our method, dubbed Upside Down Reinforcement Learning with Policy Generators (UDRLPG), streamlines comparable techniques by removing the need for an evaluator or critic to update the weights of the generator.

item.title: UDBE: Unsupervised Diffusion-based Brightness Enhancement in Underwater Images
item.description: A major challenge in this domain is the depth at which images are captured, with increasing depth resulting in a darker environment.

item.title: TopoNets: High Performing Vision and Language Models with Brain-Like Topography
item.description: Neurons in the brain are organized such that nearby cells tend to share similar functions.

item.title: LCTG Bench: LLM Controlled Text Generation Benchmark
item.description: LCTG Bench provides a unified framework for assessing control performance, enabling users to select the most suitable model for their use cases based on controllability.

item.title: CENSOR: Defense Against Gradient Inversion via Orthogonal Subspace Bayesian Sampling
item.description: Existing gradient inversion attacks can exploit this vulnerability to recover private training instances from a client's gradient vectors.

item.title: MM-Retinal V2: Transfer an Elite Knowledge Spark into Fundus Vision-Language Pretraining
item.description: Vision-language pretraining (VLP) has been investigated to generalize across diverse downstream tasks for fundus image analysis.

item.title: Multi-view Structural Convolution Network for Domain-Invariant Point Cloud Recognition of Autonomous Vehicles
item.description: In this paper, we present the Multi-View Structural Convolution Network (MSCN) designed for domain-invariant point cloud recognition.

item.title: Safe Gradient Flow for Bilevel Optimization
item.description: Bilevel optimization is a key framework in hierarchical decision-making, where one problem is embedded within the constraints of another.

item.title: Addressing Out-of-Label Hazard Detection in Dashcam Videos: Insights from the COOOL Challenge
item.description: This paper presents a novel approach for hazard analysis in dashcam footage, addressing the detection of driver reactions to hazards, the identification of hazardous objects, and the generation of descriptive captions.

item.title: SWIFT: Mapping Sub-series with Wavelet Decomposition Improves Time Series Forecasting
item.description: In this paper, we propose $\textit{SWIFT}$, a lightweight model that is not only powerful, but also efficient in deployment and inference for Long-term Time Series Forecasting (LTSF).

item.title: SPECIAL: Zero-shot Hyperspectral Image Classification With CLIP
item.description: Hyperspectral image (HSI) classification aims at categorizing each pixel in an HSI into a specific land cover class, which is crucial for applications like remote sensing, environmental monitoring, and agriculture.

item.title: Detecting clinician implicit biases in diagnoses using proximal causal inference
item.description: In this work, we propose a causal inference approach to detect the effect of clinician implicit biases on patient outcomes in large-scale medical data.

item.title: Improving Tropical Cyclone Forecasting With Video Diffusion Models
item.description: Tropical cyclone (TC) forecasting is crucial for disaster preparedness and mitigation.

item.title: Efficient Attention-Sharing Information Distillation Transformer for Lightweight Single Image Super-Resolution
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose the Attention-Sharing Information Distillation (ASID) network, a lightweight SR network that integrates attention-sharing and an information distillation structure specifically designed for Transformer-based SR methods.

item.title: Reconciling Predictive Multiplicity in Practice
item.description: This issue is exemplified by the model multiplicity (MM) phenomenon, where a set of comparable models yield inconsistent predictions.

item.title: DepoRanker: A Web Tool to predict Klebsiella Depolymerases using Machine Learning
item.description: Objective: To develop a machine learning model for identifying and ranking potential phage depolymerases targeting Klebsiella.

item.title: Benchmarking Quantum Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Benchmarking and establishing proper statistical validation metrics for reinforcement learning (RL) remain ongoing challenges, where no consensus has been established yet.

item.title: CoCoNUT: Structural Code Understanding does not fall out of a tree
item.description: In this work, we demonstrate that high performance on such benchmarks does not correlate to humans' innate ability to understand structural control flow in code.

item.title: Parametric Retrieval Augmented Generation
item.description: To this end, we introduce Parametric retrieval-augmented generation (Parametric RAG), a new RAG paradigm that integrates external knowledge directly into the parameters of feed-forward networks (FFN) of an LLM through document parameterization.

item.title: LUCY: Linguistic Understanding and Control Yielding Early Stage of Her
item.description: The film Her features Samantha, a sophisticated AI audio agent who is capable of understanding both linguistic and paralinguistic information in human speech and delivering real-time responses that are natural, informative and sensitive to emotional subtleties.
